Package project

Class Shopping

java.lang.Object
project.Shopping
public class Shopping
extends java.lang.Object
Shopping class, this class handles user input and prints the output to Console. The run method is called from the RunProject1 Class, the driver class for the entire project. The run method then scans the user input and passes it to the processUserInput method which contains a while loop which continues to process input until the command "Q" is entered.
Author:
Mohamed Moussa, Christian Rodriguez

  • Constructor Details

    • Shopping

      public Shopping()

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Instantiates a ShoppingBag object along with Scanner instance to begin reading input. ShoppingBag object and Scanner are passed to processUserInput to begin processing input. Run() is called from the driver class, RunProject1, and sets up the variables to be used in the other methods.

    • processUserInput

      private void processUserInput​(java.util.Scanner scanner, ShoppingBag customerBag)
      Reads and processes user input from console using Scanner. The scanner method used returns an array with white spaces as elements in the array. Thus reOrderInputs is used following any input read in order to ensure that the white spaces do not appear in the first four indices of the array. This is necessary as the commands are accessed in the while loop from indices [0-3] in a while loop is used to process user input until the command "Q" is used; inside the while loop the commands are dealt with in subsequent methods. If statements inside the while loop are used to determine method calls which then separate Invalid and valid commands.
      Parameters:
      scanner - object that processes Input from System.in
      customerBag - , user's shopping bag

    • reorderInputs

      private void reorderInputs​(java.lang.String[] inputs)
      Reorders user inputs to the first four indices of the inputs array. Assuming that if first input is valid then the rest of the inputs are valid, based off of Project Write up, then at most the first four indices contain our inputs. If it is four lettered command, else only the first index contains our input for single letter commands. This method is called exclusively from processUserInput().
      Parameters:
      inputs - array containing user inputs and possible white spaces

    • evaulateSingleLetterCommand

      private void evaulateSingleLetterCommand​(ShoppingBag customerBag, java.lang.String command)
      Determines which one of the single letter commands P,Q, or C was inputed. It will flag any other letter(s) as invalid input. Each command is then called by it's respective method which determines which action to take. This method is called exclusively from processUserInput().
      Parameters:
      customerBag - user's shopping bag
      command - ,the given user input

    • evaulateC

      private void evaulateC​(ShoppingBag customerBag)
      Evaluates Checkout command and checks out the items in current ShoppingBag. Splits the Checkout Process into three Steps: Printing Number of items in the Bag. Printing the items in the bag, and printing the sales total and tax which is handled in finalizeCheckout Uses non static print() method to print the contents of the ShoppingBag and The bag is emptied in the userProcessInput method, caller.
      Parameters:
      customerBag - object that contains current Customer's customerBag

    • finalizeCheckout

      private void finalizeCheckout​(ShoppingBag customerBag)
      Determines the sales total, sales tax, and the total price to be output. Called by evaulateC() after the first two steps of the Checkout Process have been completed.
      Parameters:
      customerBag - user's Shopping bag

    • formattedSales

      private java.lang.String formattedSales​(double sales)
      Converts a double to a string and formats to the form. $xx.xx. This method is used by finalizeCheckout when the sales are being prepared to be output to the User.
      Parameters:
      sales - double value to formatted to monetary format
      Returns:
      String representation of the double properly formatted in monetary format

    • totalPrice

      private double totalPrice​(ShoppingBag customerBag)
      Calculates the total price Customer must pay. Uses ShoppingBag methods salesPrice() and salexTax() to determine sales Total. Helper Method to finalize Checkout
      Parameters:
      customerBag - user's Shopping bag
      Returns:
      double value of the total price of all items in the user's Shopping bag, sales tax included

    • evaulateP

      private void evaulateP​(ShoppingBag customerBag)
      Evaluates Print comment based on number of Items in the ShoppingBag object. Prints number of item's in the bag using Global variable followed by printing each item in the ShoppingBag using the non-static print method of the ShoppingBag object to print each item in the ShoppingBag
      Parameters:
      customerBag - user's shopping bag

    • evaulateAddorRemove

      private void evaulateAddorRemove​(java.util.Scanner scanner, ShoppingBag customerBag, java.lang.String[] inputs, java.lang.String command)
      Determines which FourLetterInput is inputed,Add or Remove. The respective method that evaluates the FourLetterInput is called, if it is an Invalid command an error is output. Assumes that inputs Following A/R are valid as stated in WriteUp.
      Parameters:
      scanner - instance that is used to scan System.in input
      customerBag - user's shopping bag
      inputs - array of inputs given by the user
      command - given command by the user

    • evaulateA

      private void evaulateA​(java.util.Scanner scanner, ShoppingBag customerBag, java.lang.String[] scannerInputs)
      Evaluates Add command creates GroceryItem instance based on User Input. The GroceryItem is then added to the ShoppingBag instance using the non-static add method. Since we call reOrderInputs in proccessUserInputs as necessary the inputs are in indices 0,1,2,3 respectively. Calls inputLengthChecker to determine if desired inputs are given.
      Parameters:
      scanner - instance that is used to scan System.in input
      customerBag - user's shopping bag
      scannerInputs - array of inputs given by the user

    • inputLengthChecker

      private java.lang.String[] inputLengthChecker​(java.util.Scanner scanner, java.lang.String[] inputs)
      Determines if the original Console Input for 4 letter Command is met. If not calls scanFutherInputs which scans further inputs until all 4 inputs are given and returns the inputs in a String array. If all the inputs are inputed on the first attempt the return argument, is the original scanned String array. Since the scanner inputs are always reOrdered we check sequentially, for inputs in the String array.
      Parameters:
      scanner - instance that is used to scan System.in input
      inputs - string array containing scanned inputs
      Returns:
      String array with the four inputs required for Add or Remove

    • scanFurtherInputs

      private java.lang.String[] scanFurtherInputs​(java.util.Scanner scanner, java.lang.String[] scannerInputs, int numOfInputsScanned)
      Scans further inputs from user while keeping track of previous inputs. Continues to Scan until all needed inputs have been provided. Copy is used to copy the valid inputs from the scanned array to the stored array.
      Parameters:
      scanner - instance that is used to scan System.in input
      scannerInputs - original String array containing the scanned inputs
      numOfInputsScanned - number of inputs scanned
      Returns:
      String array containing all the inputs from the user

    • validateInputs

      private int validateInputs​(java.lang.String[] inputs)
      Determines if inputs scanned are valid inputs to be copied
      Parameters:
      inputs - string array with scanned inputs
      Returns:
      Integer number of valid inputs in the String array

    • copy

      private void copy​(java.lang.String[] array1, java.lang.String[] array2, int offset, int endingIndex)
      Copies elements from array1 to array2 given a specific offset and endingIndex.
      Parameters:
      array1 - to be copied from
      array2 - to be copied to
      offset - displacement index number
      endingIndex - ending index position

    • evaulateR

      private void evaulateR​(java.util.Scanner scanner, ShoppingBag customerBag, java.lang.String[] scannerInputs)
      Evaluates Remove command by creating a GroceryItem instance and removes from Shopping Bag. Calls non-static remove method that belongs to ShoppingBag. If the GroceryItem couldn't be removed a message is displayed to the user.
      Parameters:
      scanner - takes in user input
      customerBag - user's shopping bag
      scannerInputs - array of inputs given by the user
